intro: Psychotria liogieri, commonly known as the "Little Psychotria," is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly found in the understory of humid forests. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale green flowers. It produces small, red berries that are often used in traditional medicine. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
